Albania: Some Albanians who converted to Islam found careers in the government and military services of the Ottoman Empire.
A mass conversion of Albanians began which would see some two-thirds of them become Muslims.
Estonia: Battle at Narva, where the Swedish army under King Charles XII defeats the Russian army.
Germany: Leibniz founded the Prussian Academy of Sciences.
Indinesia: With the decline of the spice trade, textiles are now the most important trade item in the Dutch East Indies.
Latvia: Great Northern War: A war began which involved the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth, Sweden, and Russia.
Russia: Great Northern War: Muscovy declared war on Sweden.
Adrian, the patriarch of the Russian Orthodox Church, died. Peter prevented the election of a successor.
Sweden: An alliance consisting of Denmark-Norway, Saxony, Poland and Russia declares war on Sweden, initiating the Great Northern War.
The Battle of Narva takes place.
Tanzania: Over 100,000 slaves pass through Zanzibar as part of the Arab slave trade. (to 1800)
USA: Richard Coote, 1st Earl of Bellomont resigned his commission as governor of New York, leaving his lieutenant John Nanfan in office as acting governor.
